reviewText: Although this concert was filmed good and of good quality, I am very glad I rented it instead of buying it because THIS IS NOT BAD COMPANY. Like another reviewer said, there is something missing. That is Mick Ralph's great guitar sound, which IS THE SOUND of Bad CO. Without him this band should be titled Half Bad CO., and is nothing but an above average cover band in my opinion. Just because Paul Rogers rejoined the band for a reunion tour, does not mean this is even close to being the band Bad Company. Free maybe, Paul Rogers doing Bad Co. tunes yes.Besides, the absoulte best last Bad Company album didn't even have Paul Rogers, it had all orginal members plus a young and better fresher soounding Paul Rogers like singer named Robert Hart. The album was titled "Company Of Strangers". Bad Company screwed themselves letting Paul Rogers back in the band for a reunion tour. I think Rogers was affraid of Bad CO's new singers' abilities to write new great songs with the ORIGINAL BAD CO sound and original flavor. This is the only reason Rogers wanted a reunion with the orginal members. They didn't need him. What happened now is Rogers took over and the origianl BAD CO sound is lost yet again. You want a great Bad Co CD, go buy "Company Of Strangers". The singer Robert Hart was the best thing to ever happen to them. Shame it only lasted two CDs.

reviewText: Video and audio are excellent quality - I think someone made a comment about 5.1 - the whole concert is available and sounds great in DTS 5.1 and Dolby 5.1 is another choice.  I did not realize how many hits Bad Co. has had - I thoroughly enjoyed the show.Improvements would be a) The usual less camera swapping - these video freaks seem to need to show their talents at showing as many views in as little time as possible (this video is not near as bad as some for changing views - just could be better)and b) the lead singer went to the audience sing-along in 3 songs - maybe 25% of the song in 2 of them and unfortunately way, way too long in one song such that the band almost did not sing the chorus at all - just the audience.By the way - I have no idea why they made the "hidden" song so hard to find - I found it only by searching the comments of others on the Amazon reviews and here is how to find it:  On the special features menu, highlight "Web Links" and press left on the remote. This will take you to the hidden track "Saving Grace" recorded by Bad Company with Neal Schon plus some rehearsal footage for the same cut.

reviewText: This is a must have video for any fan of Bad Company and or Paul Rodgers. Rodgers voice (which just seems to get even better with age) leads the band through all their classics and some from his earlier days with Free.

reviewText: Well I was not sure what to expect from this new version of the band without Mick Ralphs, but I must  say they were as good as I have ever heard them here. I have seen the band twice, once in their hayday and once a few years ago.Paul Rodgers was in top form sounding bluesy and soulful as ever. The sound and video production were top flight, really what a concert DVD should be. The song selection could not have been better in my opinion, every single classic song was played in this show, I was as happy with this DVD as I have been in a while with any DVD. If your a BAD COMPANY FAN in any way shape or form get this DVD, even if you never really heard them and you love rock and roll give this one a try!

reviewText: BAD COMPANY-MERCHANTS OF COOL (DVD): BAD COMPANY, that meat 'n taters 70s hard rockin' supergroup fronted by gritty powerhouse belter PAUL RODGERS, is fairly represented on this 2002 concert DVD, even tho' he and his ex-FREE partner, drummer SIMON KIRKE are the only familiar faces this time around. Not that it matters much...far better this grouping than the generic BRIAN HOWE-fronted version of 80s-era BAD CO. No frontman can do their classic catalogue justice like blooze wailer/soul impaler RODGERS; in fact, FREE's exhuberant classics WISHING WELL and ALL RIGHT NOW are tossed into the show for greasy good measure. Most of the vital BC hits get their due here, from romper-stomper singalongs CAN'T GET ENOUGH, ROCK & ROLL FANTASY and GOOD LOVIN' GONE BAD to cooly emoted ballads FEEL LIKE MAKIN' LOVE and SEAGULL, so few fans of the original band will feel cheated. This outfit has endured numerous lineups with varying degrees of success, but so long as there's a leathery breath left in his lungs, long may PAUL RODGERS' sanctifying take on BAD COMPANY rock!RATING: FOUR BAD BOYS

reviewText: Bad Company was one of my favorite bands during high school. I have been listening to Paul Rodgers even before Bad Company (Free) and after (The Firm). I recently viewed this disc thanks to Netflix. I am always a little apprehensive hoping father time has been kind. I do not think Paul has lost anything from his voice and, if anything, he sounds even better and more soulful. Paul Rodgers is easily one of the all time great rock vocalists and this DVD shows him at his best. The production qualities are tremendous. This may not be all the original band members, but close your eyes and listen! They sound GREAT.About the only thing to top this DVD would be to add Jimmy Page playing lead guitar and doing some of the music from the two The Firm LPs. One can always dream!

reviewText: I remember the excellent music of FREE and Bad Company from years ago, but had not heard of anything new since the demise of the FIRM.  Then, I saw Simon Kirke on one of Ringo Starr's wonderful shows, and he was every bit as good as he had been in my memories!  I searched, and found this DVD of the newly reformed Bad Company, and bought it quickly!  Paul Rodgers may be the best rock vocalist to ever grace the airwaves, but I believe he is at his best with Kirke providing the solid, "rock steady" foundation.  This is what you get on this DVD!  They do "Wishing Well" & "All Right Now" in conjuction to the magnificent Bad Company Hits.  Mick Ralphs isn't here, but another guitarist fills in for him well enough.  I like the new bassist, and have just played this DVD over, and over, again!  The show presented here is wonderful, with Rodgers displaying a marvelous "frontman" skill along with his voice.  This type of performance is the kind that really comes across well with DVD technology.  The DVD has many special features, including a "hidden" song,(though I have not found it yet), and interviews with "friends" including Tommy Shaw from STYX, the Jabo Stokes Jive Rockets Band, and the Damm Yankees.  I hope the hidden song is either "Fire & Water", or "My Brother Jake" from the FREE days, but regardless, this DVD is WELL WORTH the purchase!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This concert DVD is the reunion of two Bad Company original members....vocalist Paul rodgers and drummer Simon Kirke. Some folks lament the absence of the orginal guitarist and bassist from this DVD, but these guys had retired from live performing by 2001. This DVD is basically as good as it's gonna get for a real reunion.Dave Colwell takes over in the place of original guitarist Mick Ralphs. Dave apprenticed under mentor Mick during the second incarnation of the 1980's Bad Company....so he does a good job getting the sound and style right.This DVD does virtually all the big hits of the original Bad Company. Being the fan I am, I was a little disappointed to not hear more album cuts, but I am sure that every diehard fan has his favorites and BadCo can't accomodate every one of them.A VERY GOOD companion to this the concert DVD of Paul Rodgers in Glasgow, where he does numerous Bad Company songs but also includes stuff from Free, his time with The Firm, and solo years.I like the setlist of Merchants Of Cool, but I really like the setlist of the Glasgow DVD also. The "Merchants" DVD only utilizes a 4 piece band, while there is a 5 piece on the Glasgow DVD, enabling the songs to sound fuller and closer to the recording.All in all, I think that fans should own both.

reviewText: Paul sounded awesome. Would have gotten 5 stars if sound quality was better in back up vocals/instrumentation and crowd. I agree w/some of the reviewers about the crowd. It was bad because you couldn't hear them at all and I like Paul's voice better, but that doesn't litter entire dvd, just a few moments in a few songs. With that said, Paul's performance is awesome. A must buy even w/the other minor problems this DVD has. His voice in the songs comes in crystal clear and is crankable. One can look past the other inperfections of sound by the band members- meaning sound mixer did horrible job-not the band members. I thought the lead guitarist was very adequate. Of course not the original, but he tried hard and performed pretty well. You will be very happy w/this dvd. I place it 3rd, behind ELO then Styx, just above Doobie Bros in my top four of music dvd collection (15 total).
summary: Awesome Paul Performance - a must purchase
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Merchants Of Cool" is a pretty cool DVD that combines video from two concerts staged by the new look Bad Company during their 2002 tour of the US.I say new look because the band on this DVD comprises vocalist Paul Rodgers and drummer Simon Kirke from the original Bad Co line-up with bassist Jaz Lochrie and guitarist Dave "Bucket" Colwell filling in for original members Boz Burrell and Mick Ralphs.Lochrie and Colwell are both great musicians but they aren't a patch on Burrell and Ralphs, whose distinctive guitaring style is sorely missed here.Despite this, this is a rock solid concert video featuring the best known songs from the Bad Co catalogue - you have the hits like "Bad Company", "Ready For Love", "Can't Get Enough" and "Feel Like Makin' Love" mixed up with lesser known cuts like "Good Lovin' Gone Bad" and "Seagull" - plus a few tracks from the band Free like the famous sing along anthem "All Right Now" and "Wishing Well" (for which the band is joined by Slash and Neal Schon). Rounding off things is the video for a new song from Bad Company called "Joe Fabulous".But it is a bit distracting that the DVD mixes up footage from two separate shows at the Paramount Theatre in Denver and the Grove Of Anaheim at Anaheim that were recorded in January 2002. Rodgers' decision to get the crowd to sing along on a few tracks is a bit annoying too.On the plus side, Mr Paul Rodgers does possess probably the best blues vocal chords ever, and he is in great form on all the songs. Kirke's drumming can only be described in one word - powerhouse.The footage is nice and sharp, with no bleeding of colours but the video is non-anamorphic widescreen. On the audio end of things, you get Dolby Digital 2.0 stereo and two great surround tracks - Dolby Digital 5.1 and DTS - with very nice low end for the subwoofers. This is one DVD you'll enjoy watching at loud volumes!The DVD has a nice selection of extras - including a text biography of Bad Company, track-by-track comments over a few pages of text, interviews with the musicians a section on "Famous Friends" that has members of bands like Foreigner, Journey and Styx telling us why they like Bad Company so much.There's also a easter egg - on the special features menu, highlight "Web Links" and press left on the remote. This will take you to the hidden track "Saving Grace" recorded by Bad Company with Neal Schon plus some rehearshal footage for the same cut.
summary: Solid rock from Paul Rodgers and the boys
Title: N/A

reviewText: Became back in touch with Bad Company and Paul Rodger's music after the Return of the Champions tour. I first bought the Merchants of Cool cd and after playing it non-stop for three days, had to see the dvd. It didn't disappoint! From the first song, Burning Sky, the heat and the passion of the band came screaming thru. Loved the simplicity of the set and the cool shots of all the band members. The star, as always though, is Paul Rodgers. What he achieves vocally is absolutely amazing to watch. He never cheats on a song, the way he does changes and draws out notes is breathtaking. Good Loving Gone Bad, Feel Like Making Love, Rock Steady and Silver, Blue and Gold really stand out. Love the way he does the Beatles at the end of Rock and Roll Fantasy. Don't like to hear that song any other way now! The jam session of Wishing Well is worth the price of the dvd alone. A must have for any Paul fans.

reviewText: I really had marginal expectations when I bought this. I always liked Paul and it seemed Bad Company was always on the radio with a new hit. Now I can see why. They have a lot of great songs and play just about all of them here. Unlike many bands these days (U2 & Bruce come to mind right away..like them both) Bad Company is faithful to the version of the songs you are familiar with. While allowing for a little stretching, they are tight and on target the entire show. Paul's singing is as good as ever. I recommend this DVD highly because unlike some, this one Delivers a very nice surprise you might not expect.

reviewText: I am a huge Paul Rodgers, Free and Bad Company fan and I was very pleased with the DVD.Like most, I didn't care for Paul completely leaving the chorus of Can't Get Enough and Alright Now totally to the fans.  It would have been nice for him to at least sing a couple of those choruses himself.  Paul does some good versions of these two songs on the Strat Pack DVD with backing vocals which I think was an improvement.  Also the Strat Pack DVD includes a version of Muddy Water Blues and Paul leading an all-star jam of the Faces classic Stay with Me.The song selection in Merchants of Cool was fine as none of the hits were missing but I would have liked for them to included Free's Fire and Water.  Rock and Roll Fantasy was never my favorite but I like this version with the inclusion of the Beatles songs in the middle.  I like the guitar solo in Ready for Love instead of the piano that was in the original version.This is a must have for all Bad Company fans and let's keep a look out and our fingers crossed for the Don Kirshner appearances and Free at the Isle of Wright on DVD.
Title: N/A
